title: why you shouldn't compare religion with science
description:

transcription: {"text": "As a religious person myself, I choose to believe in things like the resurrection based on faith, but not on evidence. Other than doubting Thomas, nobody had evidence that Jesus was resurrected. He saw the f***ing holes that went through his hands and his ribs. So, I choose to separate the two things. My understanding and study of physics, science, evolutionary psychology, when I look at all of that, I choose to say, this is the scientific part, and I use scientific data and scientific studies to come up with theories here, and hope my religious beliefs are based on faith. Where we conflate the two is when we start saying, I strongly believe the Earth was created in seven days because I read it in this book. It has no scientific backing, and therefore, now this is a fact. That's what I believe. Some people, they find that offensive. They have a hard time with that. Anything I do believe that's religious, I believe it based on faith, not on evidence. And I don't conflate the two things.
